justification: The study used a variant of a behavioral task to quantify affective reactivity by embedding self-report probes of participants' momentary affective valence. Computational modeling was employed to analyze these self-reports from the task.
Participants completed the GAD-7 questionnaire to assess the severity of their anxiety symptoms.
The 7-down subscale was used to measure participants' self-reported severity of depression symptoms.
The 7-up subscale was used to assess participants' self-reported severity of hypomania symptoms.
The SHAPS was utilized to measure participants' self-reported severity of anhedonia symptoms, with scores being reverse-coded to maintain consistency.

measured_by: Variation within ecological momentary assessment (EMA) and task-based measures
justification: The study implies that greater variation in emotion self-reports is associated with increased symptoms of emotion dysregulation, as seen in participants with higher anxiety and hypomania symptoms who showed more unsystematic variation in affect.
